Column Comment.0: ENTITLEMENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the row in the entitlement table.
Column Comment.1: SECURITY GROUP ID: Unique identifier for the security group. A security groupidentifies a set of users (or companies or organizations) who have a defined set ofaccess attributes based on a business function or activity.
Column Comment.2: GROUP OBSERVATION NUMBER: A unique value that allows a security group tobe associated with an entitlement in different ways over time. This number should bereset to 0 for each new occurrence of entitlement and security group.
Column Comment.3: ACCESS CONDITION: Narrative description of the access conditions that may beplaced on an object. May be that data cannot be removed from premises, or thatwritten consent must be obtained.
Column Comment.4: ACCESS TYPE: The type of access that has been granted to this group for theentitlement.
Column Comment.5: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.7: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.8: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.9: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.10: RESTRICTION DESCRIPTION: description of the restrictions that are applied to thisgroups entitlement.
Column Comment.11: SECURITY DESCRIPTION: A narrative description of the security for this group,supplemented by additional columns to describe access conditions and usageconditions.
Column Comment.12: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.13: USE DESCRIPTION: Narrative description of the uses that an object may be put toby this group.
Column Comment.14: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.15: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.16: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.17: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.18: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.19: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.20: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
